comment: Professor Brinsmaid is one of the best in the English department. If you read the assigned material and attend class, you will do well. Lectures are actually enjoyable compared to other English classes. 10/10 would take again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I am not one who typically enjoys Literature classes but Matt has made this class fun and interesting. He's incredibly nice and understanding and is willing to help. We have a lot of readings and quizzes but if you read them and take a few notes the quizzes are super easy. He's very easy to talk to and he's funny. I highly highly recommend him.

you have to read A LOT but the class is very easy. i was in his engl 2110 and the only grades were quizzes over each of the readings and one group project. Brinsmaid is the most understanding professor and he honestly doesnt care about anything except your success!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Super chill guy. You need to show up because there are several in-class responses for participation credit, but they are super simple just to get you some credit. He is caring and wants to help. I had in-class responses, a group presentation, a few response papers, and a claim paper. I made an A on pretty much everything.

Super chill and nice professor. Easy to talk to and only things that are graded are essays written outside of class so class isnt really mandatory. Only homework are the essays outside of class but i mean it takes 2 hours out of your couple weeks its due.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Brinsmaid provides a great class. There is lots of reading, but very little writing. Fun class, and great professor. I would recommend him for anyone looking for a ENGL 2110 class.
Brinsmaid really is a terrific teacher. He works with all his students, and is very understanding. He doesn't give our free A's, however, as your writing should be exemplary.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: He is one of the most genuine professors I have had. He cares about each student and loves making his class like a family. He loves talkers. His class consisted of 18 scheduled/unscheduled quizzes total. No tests. One group project. A lot of reading, but if you read, you will ace the quizzes. 10/10 reccomend.

Professor Brinsmaid is an awesome teacher. He definitely cares about his students and wants them to do well. He does a very good job at giving instructions for his papers. No quizzes, about 5 papers, and a group project. I loved his class. Would definitely take it again.
A lot of long plays to read, lot of quizzes, but if you read the plays you'll do fine. One group project and 3 response papers. He's amazing! I recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He has a great personality and is so nice and understanding. There is a quiz for every reading so it is important to read the material. There are 3 papers based off the readings. The readings are pretty interesting and the class is mostly group discussion. There is also 1 group presentation.

Mr. Brinsmaid is the best teacher I have ever had in all my 14 years of schooling. He makes everyday interesting. 1 group project and 4 papers including the final but he leaves great feedback. He is very responsive outside of class too. If you have the option to take his class, do it!

He's awesome! 18 quizzes, all very easy and multiple choice (as long as you read). Drops the lowest 3 quizzes, one big group project, 3 2-page papers, no final. Somewhat boring lectures, but he's funny and really cares. There is a lot of reading, but what can you expect from a literature class? Take him!
Highly recommend taking him. Hes a great guy and is always there to help his students

AMAZING!! TAKE HIM!!!! Pretty easy, 6 papers (3 short, 1 just a second draft of "midterm") and small group project. FAIR and CARING. Great feedback and good grades. Treats you as an individual and loves hearing your viewpoint if you can back it up and use reasoning. TAKE HIM!!!

Loved him! if you participate in class you will do well! only 3 paper and longest was 4 pages, no tests, only reading quizzes and he tells you when they are and what they are over. One big group project but grades pretty lenient. Would definitely take again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: AWESOME! He gives you several papers to write and one big one at the end of the semester, but he guides you through them and he's always there to talk to! A couple in class writing days too! I have written some of the smaller papers in like 2 hours! Funny, Cool, Easy Grader, Good Feedback, with a highlighter and a pen and you'll ace this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Easy class to get through as long as you put some effort in. Great professor, helped me improve my writing, would recommend to anyone that needs to take ENG 1101. Had one group project. Only remotely terrible thing was that one month, we had three essays to turn in, almost every week.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Wonderful! He is a great guy and a lot of fun. Let us out early pretty often. A group project or two, but mostly essays. Very accessible, and easy to talk too. The work piles up quick. As long as you stay on top of the essays you'll be fine.

Matt is one of the best English professors I've had. Even if you don't like English, or don't care (at first) what you have to write about, he'll inspire you to find something to write about. He has in class writing days to help you write your papers when needed. He's hilarious and cares about his students. TAKE HIM.

Mr. Brinsmaid is by far one of the top professors I've taken at KSU. He will ask you to write four  response papers, each about 2.5 pages in length; and has about 14 quizzes throughout the semester over our readings, of which he will drop the 4 or 5 lowest grades.   Brinsmaid is a thoughtful, articulate man. He's as genuine as they get.
Literally one of the best professors I have ever had. He makes class exciting. We had 4 papers and a quiz every week or so over readings. You can tell he cares about his students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Mr. Brinsmaid is the best english teacher I have ever had! I have NEVER liked literature classes but I loved his class! It was a 3 hour Friday class, but he always lightened the mood. You have 3 or 4 papers and a group project as your main grades. All very simple and straight forward. Quizzes were easy, just use spark notes. Easy A!

Incredible teacher! He always came to class with an upbeat, happy attitude. We had three essays and he gives short statements on how to improve for the next one. The final is one longer 4th essay which is easy since after your first draft he gives amazing feedback for the final draft. Take him!

Professor Brinsmaid is amazing! His 1102 course is very easy and is pretty much the same as his 1101 course (I finished w/ an A). The assignments from both courses are very similar. There are 2 papers in the beginning of the semester, a claim paper, & a claim paper revision (your final). You can only miss 5 classes before you automatically fail.
Matt is an awesome teacher! Lectures a lot and there's a lot of reading and quizzes but if you show up and do the work you'll be fine!
Brinsmaid is definently one of the best professors I have had before. Even though I genuinely do not like English, I still really enjoyed having him and having this class.
Nicest professor I have had all semester. He is so helpful working with you on your papers. Go to class, its part of the grade. Would take him again if I could!!

Matt (that's what we call him) is an amazing English professor. His class is very simple, no test and quizzes as long as you can engage in class discussions. We had only two papers which were fairly short (3 pg & 4.5 pg). Go to class because the English dpt.  requires that if you miss 5 classes then you receive and F. I would take him  again!

Incredibly easy class if you show up and pay attention most of the time.  He's pretty weird about attendance and sometimes his lectures are really boring. Definitely would take again. Group project is super easy - no tests and quizzes all semester.

One group project, super easy. May sound hard at first, but it's not. Quizzes every week, read the material and you'll do fine. He drops the lowest 2 quiz grades out of 12. He is hilarious and is easy to talk to. I have him for a 3 hour class on Friday and I don't ever dread going into his class! No tests! Just papers! Best lit professor at KSU!
easy class for engl 1102.  easy grader.  take himm.

Totally love Mr. Brinsmaid. He mad the class enjoyable everyday and made me actually want to come. Even he'll tell you that he's a talker, but this just means that any questions you have he'll over explain it, trying to make sure you understand. @ papers all year long, the final is a revision of the 2nd paper. Awesome teacher! taking him next year.

I always received A's in high school English, but this guy said he didn't like the reviews on this website saying he was too easy of a teacher.  I got a C on my first paper and went to the lab.  They thought it was good.  I got a B on the revision.  Take someone else.  First B in writing for me.
One of the best teachers at KSU.
Awesome.

TAKE HIM.  I only wrote two papers the entire semester, and there were only a couple more assignments beyond that.  The final exam was merely a revised draft of the second paper.  I read one (interesting) novel and a short story.  Essentially, just show up to class, put in the effort when needed, and you'll come out with a good grade.

Great teacher. Attendance is required (by university, not teacher).  Easy class (only papers, no tests,) not harsh with grading, but he will help in developing writing if needed. Provides excellent commentary on papers, and keeps an otherwise dull class interesting. If you contact him, he will respond very quickly. Lives up to his reputation.

Mr. Brinsmaid was the best english teacher I have ever had! I never saw myself as a good writer, but I made 95's on all 3 of the papers we had. This class is very easy as long as you put forth an effort! I would definitely take him again if I could!

Brinsmaid was the best english teacher I have ever had and I would take his class again in a heart beat. There are no tests. There are three papers the first one was on how to build a fire I wrote it the day of and made an 85 and I am not a good writer. The last two papers are on into the wild and the second one is just a revision of the first one.

Mr. Brinsmaid is easily my favorite English teacher I've ever had. He is very passionate about English and really cares about his students and their grades. Class discussions are always interesting, and he is extremely helpful with your writing. Goes over basically everything you need to know for papers. Freshmen, take this class!!!!

Matt starts off the semester by telling you he's your friend, oh! and that he doesn't give tests. What?! NO TESTS (not including final)! He always has a study session at the library for extra help, is very passionate about English and Literature, and he clearly explains what he wants for papers. TAKE HIS CLASS IF YOU ARE A FRESHMAN. #NoRegrets
GREAT PROFESSOR!! Passionate and makes the material and assigned readings easy to understand. Easy grader I think. Would take him again!!! Really cares about his students. Can't go wrong with him!!!!

He's the best english teacher I have ever had. 4 essays but 2 of the 4 are redos of the previous essay you had to write. They are long 5-7 pages double spaced but he helps. He goes over basically everything you need to write the paper. He's helpful, he loves what he does, and he really cares about his students.

Brinsmaid is a GREAT professor. He is very clear with his instructions and is funny. He doesn't give quizzes or tests, only papers and that basically sums up your grade for the class. If you participate and go to the writing center, you'll get good grades on your papers. Would take again!!!

Wonderful Wonderful professor.  Wouldn't have asked for a better professor for my first English class as a freshman.  So helpful and does everything he can to pass his students.  Class isn't mandatory but is always helpful to go.  Great class discussions too!  He's the best!

Hard! He is nice and willing to meet up but I'm a quality writer and I got a C. He marks up everyone's paper like he is a DR. It's ridiculous! I would suggest another lit teacher. There are far easier teachers than Professor Brinsmaid! Attendance is 10% and then papers comprise the rest of the grade! Run, don't take him! It's your fair warning!

By far the best professor at Kennesaw. He is extremely helpful and always willing to meet up with students outside of class for additional help. He genuinely cares about his students. I recommend him to everyone. Outstanding professor.

great professor!! extremely friendly and loves to talk. class almost always ends early and the days papers are due, you leave right after turn it :) only 2 real papers. no quizzes or tests. go to class and read the material and you will do just fine!
HE IS THE BEST PROFESSOR AT KSU! Take him, he is so excited to teach the subject and becomes very personal with students!

Love Prof Brinsmaid. He is very helpful and interesting. He tries really hard to remember your name and become very personable with his students! Take this class you only write 4 essays and he gives you the thesis paragraph! You read a lot but he reviews in class what you read so you understand it!
Professor Brinsmaid was an amazing teacher!! Super helpful and very personal with his students. Overall completely wonderful!
